                                            [id] => 14
                                            [name] =>  Uttam Bose
                                            [place_name] => Europe & Turkey Trip
                                            [image] => 17109362211710828528Uttam Bose.webp
                                            [comments] => Recently, we went for a vacation to a few Eastern European countries and Santorini/Istanbul.
We were planning this particular trip since last year but could not make it due to the uncertainty hovering over the pandemic. Finally we could make a very satisfying family trip overseas. Making a multi national/destination travel plan is very harrowing job.....starting with location selection, route selection, logistic finalisation, arranging entry visas, hotel bookings etc etc
Thank God ! We assigned this job to VICTORIA TRAVEL, they did a great job. We could rest easy with the help of a very good and customer friendly team.
The best part was the execution in providing solutions for the personalised travel, it was so well orchestrated that we were mentally at peace and were able to enjoy our trip. Everyday we used to get the succeeding day's itinerary with all details in our whatsapp as a reminder. Apart from the air/train tickets, all our private transfers were so well organised that we never felt out of the home feeling.
The entire family enjoyed the vacation so well that it will remain as a sweet memory forever. Thanks to the entire team Bikash Das, Keya Chakraborty, Rima and Pronay of Victoria travels for giving us such amazing and delightful customer service. My personal rating is 10 out of 10. Continue the good job and emerge as a differentiator.
                                            [published] => 1
                                            [created_at] => 2024-03-19 11:38:48
                                            [updated_at] => 2024-03-29 00:53:55
                                        )

                                            [id] => 3
                                            [blog_category] => 4
                                            [title] => Commercial Ministry to Hike Import Duty on Aluminium
                                            [slug] => commercial-ministry-to-hike-import-duty-on-aluminium-3
                                            [content_date] => 2019-10-23
                                            [description] => <p>The commerce and industry minister said that there has been a complaint by aluminium industry about dumping of the commodity.He was replying to a question about the government&rsquo;s plan to increase import duty on aluminium.The commerce ministry is in favour of hiking import duty on aluminium with a view to support domestic manufacturers, Union Minister Suresh Prabhu has said.</p>

<p>&ldquo;That is a proposal to protect our domestic industry. The proposal is under examination and we support the proposal,&rdquo; Prabhu told PTI.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>The industry has demanded increase in import duties on aluminium scrap and primary aluminium amid a high growth in inward shipments of these items. Currently, the basic customs duty on aluminium scrap and primary aluminium is 2.5 per cent and 7.5 per cent, respectively.</p>

<p>Besides this, domestic players have also urged to impose minimum import price and some kind of quota on the imports for the user industry.Total production of aluminium in India is about 4 million tonnes and consumption is about 3.6 million tonnes.</p>

                                            [image] => 1675747998pic8.jpg
                                            [post_by] => GBC ADMIN
                                            [published] => 1
                                            [created_at] => 2023-02-07 11:03:18
                                            [updated_at] => 2023-02-15 11:41:38
                                        )

                                    [1] => stdClass Object
                                        (
                                            [id] => 2
                                            [blog_category] => 4
                                            [title] => Commercial Ministry to Hike Import Duty on Aluminium
                                            [slug] => commercial-ministry-to-hike-import-duty-on-aluminium-2
                                            [content_date] => 2019-10-23
                                            [description] => <p>Currently, the basic customs duty on aluminium scrap and primary aluminium is 2.5 percent and 7.5 per cent, respectively.Besides this, domestic players have also urged to impose minimum import price and some kind of quota on the imports for the user industry.</p>

<p>Total production of aluminium in India is about 4 million tonnes and consumption is about 3.6 million tonnes.The demand comes in the wake of the US imposing 10 per cent duty on certain aluminium products. China&nbsp; too has raised the duties. All these industries are growing in India and the country is producing sufficient amount of the required metal domestically, an industry expert has said.As per estimates, during the first quarter of the current fiscal, imports of aluminium scrap increased to 36,000 tonnes from 16,000 tonnes.</p>

                                            [image] => 1675748041pic4.jpg
                                            [post_by] => GBC ADMIN
                                            [published] => 1
                                            [created_at] => 2023-02-07 10:59:12

                                            [title] => Commercial Ministry to Hike Import Duty on Aluminium
                                            [slug] => commercial-ministry-to-hike-import-duty-on-aluminium-1
                                            [content_date] => 2019-10-23
                                            [description] => <p>The commerce ministry is in favour of hiking import duty on aluminium with a view to support domestic manufacturers, Union Minister Suresh Prabhu has said.&rdquo;That is a proposal to protect our domestic industry. The proposal is under examination and we support the proposal,&rdquo; Prabhu told PTI.</p>

<p>&ldquo;That is a proposal to protect our domestic industry. The proposal is under examination and we support the proposal,&rdquo; Prabhu told PTI.</p>

<p>The commerce ministry is in favour of hiking import duty on aluminium with a view to support domestic manufacturers, Union Minister Suresh Prabhu has said.</p>

<p>Read more at:<br />
<a href="https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/67254934.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&amp;utm_medium=text&amp;utm_campaign=cppst">//economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/67254934.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&amp;utm_medium=text&amp;utm_campaign=cppst</a></p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>The commerce and industry minister said that there has been a complaint by aluminium industry about dumping of the commodity.</p>

<p>He was replying to a question about the government&rsquo;s plan to increase import duty on aluminium.The industry has demanded increase in import duties on aluminium scrap and primary aluminium amid a high growth in inward shipments of these items.</p>

<p>They are demanding to raise the duty on primary and scrap aluminium to 10 per cent.</p>

<script type="text/javascript">
    $(document).ready(function(){
        $('.send-btn').on('click', function(e){
            e.preventDefault();
            var name = $('#name').val();
            var email = $('#contact-email').val();
            var comment = $('#message').val();
            if(name == ''){
                $('#contact-err').html('Please Enter Name !!!');
                $('#contact-err').delay(5000).fadeOut();
            } else {
                if(email == ''){
                    $('#contact-err').html('Please Enter Email !!!');
                    $('#contact-err').delay(5000).fadeOut();
                } else {
                    if(comment == ''){
                        $('#contact-err').html('Please Enter Message !!!');
                        $('#contact-err').delay(5000).fadeOut();
                    } else {
                        // debugger;
                        $.post({
                            url:'https://victoriatravels.com/submit-contact',
                            dataType: 'JSON',
                            data: { name:name,email:email,comment:comment }
                        })

                        .done(function(rply) {
                            // debugger;
                            console.log(rply);
                            if(rply.status) {
                                $('#contact-succ').html(rply.message);
                                $('#contact-succ').delay(5000).fadeOut();
                                $('#name').val('');
                                $('#contact-email').val('');
                                $('#message').val('');
                                $('#captchaInput').val('');
                            } else {
                                $('#contact-err').html(rply.message);
                                $('#contact-err').delay(5000).fadeOut();
                                $('#name').val('');
                                $('#contact-email').val('');
                                $('#message').val('');
                                $('#captchaInput').val('');
                            }
                            setTimeout(function(){
                               //window.location.reload();
                            }, 5000);
                            //location.reload();
                        })
                        .fail(function(rply, txtsts) {
                            //
                        });
                    }
                }
                
            }            
        });
    });
</script>

            [id] => 14
            [name] =>  Uttam Bose
            [place_name] => Europe & Turkey Trip
            [image] => 17109362211710828528Uttam Bose.webp
            [comments] => Recently, we went for a vacation to a few Eastern European countries and Santorini/Istanbul.
We were planning this particular trip since last year but could not make it due to the uncertainty hovering over the pandemic. Finally we could make a very satisfying family trip overseas. Making a multi national/destination travel plan is very harrowing job.....starting with location selection, route selection, logistic finalisation, arranging entry visas, hotel bookings etc etc
Thank God ! We assigned this job to VICTORIA TRAVEL, they did a great job. We could rest easy with the help of a very good and customer friendly team.
The best part was the execution in providing solutions for the personalised travel, it was so well orchestrated that we were mentally at peace and were able to enjoy our trip. Everyday we used to get the succeeding day's itinerary with all details in our whatsapp as a reminder. Apart from the air/train tickets, all our private transfers were so well organised that we never felt out of the home feeling.
The entire family enjoyed the vacation so well that it will remain as a sweet memory forever. Thanks to the entire team Bikash Das, Keya Chakraborty, Rima and Pronay of Victoria travels for giving us such amazing and delightful customer service. My personal rating is 10 out of 10. Continue the good job and emerge as a differentiator.
            [published] => 1
            [created_at] => 2024-03-19 11:38:48
            [updated_at] => 2024-03-29 00:53:55

View Data.blogs:
Array
(
    [0] => stdClass Object
        (
            [id] => 3
            [blog_category] => 4
            [title] => Commercial Ministry to Hike Import Duty on Aluminium
            [slug] => commercial-ministry-to-hike-import-duty-on-aluminium-3
            [content_date] => 2019-10-23
            [description] => <p>The commerce and industry minister said that there has been a complaint by aluminium industry about dumping of the commodity.He was replying to a question about the government’s plan to increase import duty on aluminium.The commerce ministry is in favour of hiking import duty on aluminium with a view to support domestic manufacturers, Union Minister Suresh Prabhu has said.</p>

<p>“That is a proposal to protect our domestic industry. The proposal is under examination and we support the proposal,” Prabhu told PTI.</p>

<p> </p>

<p>The industry has demanded increase in import duties on aluminium scrap and primary aluminium amid a high growth in inward shipments of these items. Currently, the basic customs duty on aluminium scrap and primary aluminium is 2.5 per cent and 7.5 per cent, respectively.</p>

<p>Besides this, domestic players have also urged to impose minimum import price and some kind of quota on the imports for the user industry.Total production of aluminium in India is about 4 million tonnes and consumption is about 3.6 million tonnes.</p>

            [image] => 1675747998pic8.jpg
            [post_by] => GBC ADMIN
            [published] => 1
            [created_at] => 2023-02-07 11:03:18
            [updated_at] => 2023-02-15 11:41:38
        )

    [1] => stdClass Object
        (
            [id] => 2
            [blog_category] => 4
            [title] => Commercial Ministry to Hike Import Duty on Aluminium
            [slug] => commercial-ministry-to-hike-import-duty-on-aluminium-2
            [content_date] => 2019-10-23
            [description] => <p>Currently, the basic customs duty on aluminium scrap and primary aluminium is 2.5 percent and 7.5 per cent, respectively.Besides this, domestic players have also urged to impose minimum import price and some kind of quota on the imports for the user industry.</p>

<p>Total production of aluminium in India is about 4 million tonnes and consumption is about 3.6 million tonnes.The demand comes in the wake of the US imposing 10 per cent duty on certain aluminium products. China  too has raised the duties. All these industries are growing in India and the country is producing sufficient amount of the required metal domestically, an industry expert has said.As per estimates, during the first quarter of the current fiscal, imports of aluminium scrap increased to 36,000 tonnes from 16,000 tonnes.</p>

            [image] => 1675748041pic4.jpg

            [title] => Commercial Ministry to Hike Import Duty on Aluminium
            [slug] => commercial-ministry-to-hike-import-duty-on-aluminium-1
            [content_date] => 2019-10-23
            [description] => <p>The commerce ministry is in favour of hiking import duty on aluminium with a view to support domestic manufacturers, Union Minister Suresh Prabhu has said.”That is a proposal to protect our domestic industry. The proposal is under examination and we support the proposal,” Prabhu told PTI.</p>

<p>“That is a proposal to protect our domestic industry. The proposal is under examination and we support the proposal,” Prabhu told PTI.</p>

<p>The commerce ministry is in favour of hiking import duty on aluminium with a view to support domestic manufacturers, Union Minister Suresh Prabhu has said.</p>

<p>Read more at:<br />
<a href="https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/67254934.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppst">//economictimes.indiatimes.com/articleshow/67254934.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppst</a></p>

<p> </p>

<p>The commerce and industry minister said that there has been a complaint by aluminium industry about dumping of the commodity.</p>

<p>He was replying to a question about the government’s plan to increase import duty on aluminium.The industry has demanded increase in import duties on aluminium scrap and primary aluminium amid a high growth in inward shipments of these items.</p>

<p>They are demanding to raise the duty on primary and scrap aluminium to 10 per cent.</p>
